style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager
style.description: Mild, pale, light-bodied ale, made using a warm fermentation (top or bottom) and cold lagering. Hop bitterness and flavor range from very low to low. Hop aroma is often absent. Sometimes referred to as cream ales, these beers are crisp and refreshing. Pale malt character predominates. Caramelized malt character should be absent. A fruity or estery aroma may be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.

breweries.name: Salt Creek Brewery
breweries.description:
Salt Creek Brewery in Bedford, Indiana is Lawrence County's first and only craft brewery. Located in a comfortable and uniquely converted service garage north of Bedford on East Trogdon Lane.

This state of the art brewery was once a popular service garage. The former "alignment pit" at Salt Creek Brewery now serves as what may be the only open pit brewery in the U.S.

style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager

Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.

breweries.name: Bravo! Restaurant and Cafe
breweries.description: Our Bravo! Handcrafted beer is made in-house by our award winning chefs. We are one of the only restaurants in Kalamazoo to brew their own beer. We brew beer in small batches using natural ingredients. We never use additives or extracts. Our slow fermentation and use of all grains create the natural malt flavors of high-quality beers. Our beers have refreshing and crisp flavors which our Chef's enjoy pairing with our menu offerings.

data.name: GBR
data.description: Brewed especially for Gonerfest 11, GBR is a clean, crisp golden ale with a healthy dose of flaked corn. We decided to make it a true Memphis cream ale with a bunch of grits in the mash too.

data.name: Genesee Cream Ale
data.description: The goal was simple: a beer with the flavor of an ale and the smoothness of a lager. That's how Genesee Cream Ale (the brainchild of this brewery) became an American original. Today, every batch of Cream Ale is skillfully brewed to achieve its smooth character and a remarkably creamy white head worthy of its name.

breweries.name: Genesee Brewing Company
breweries.description:
This is a place where honest people have brewed honest beers for generations. Today, 400 employees focus on crafting and bottling quality beers every day.

Founded in 1878, The Genesee Brewing Company, based in Rochester, New York, is one of the largest and oldest continually operating breweries in the United States. The Brewery makes the Genesee line of beers, including the iconic Genesee, the refreshing Genny Light, and the original Genesee Cream Ale.

The Genesee Brewing Company is part of North American Breweries, the largest independently owned beer company in the United States. With a focus on product quality, facility upgrades (including the relighting of the iconic Genesee Beer & Ale sign), conservation initiatives and employee safety, North American Breweries has invested in the Genesee family of beers, its employees and the community.

With a refreshed sense of pride and purpose, The Genesee Brewing Company will continue brewing the quality beers that people have loved for over a century.

breweries.name: Moustache Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Born from Matthew and Lauri's passion for craft beer, Moustache Brewing Co. is a 2 BBL microbrewery located in Riverhead, New York. Moustache Brewing Co. provides Long Island and the New York City area with fresh, local and handcrafted beers.
 
The beers are based on brewing’s tradition with a nod to the trends and uniquely changing future of craft beer. the beers are constantly changing to keep our unique homebrew spirit and to highlight fresh locally grown ingredients. We are dedicated to creating, sharing and educating the masses about craft beer.

data.name: Glazed Donut Ale
data.description: A very approachable and delicious session ale- refreshing and sweet. We put glazed donuts in the mash for this one, but it's no sugar bomb. Something for the beginner and connoisseur alike. Flavors of sweet grain, donut glaze, and light wheat.

breweries.name: Argilla Brewing Co. @ Pietro's Pizza
breweries.description:
We first opened our doors in Prices Corner in 1978, later settling in Pike Creek for over 20 years. After Homebrewing for several years, we've decided to expand to our new location (2667 Kirkwood Highway - Newark, DE) and install a 1.5 barrel brewery, making us the smallest brewery in the state of Delaware. We brew beers to please all kinds, including an Amber Ale, Rye Stout and an IPA that recently won a ribbon at the Delaware State Fair Battle of the Brews.

Since we're so small, we'll be sure to experiment with several different styles of beer, so there will always be something new to check out.  Along with the beer, we'll have the same great pizzas we've been serving up for over 33 years. We'll also have soups, salads, pub sandwiches and select entrees. Also be on the lookout for our occasional beer dinners and pizza beer dinners.   We're just as passionate about our food as we are about our beer.

breweries.name: Against The Grain Brewery
breweries.description:
Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.

Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.

Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!

data.name: Golden Ale
data.description: Crisp and refreshing this golden ale is light in color but not in flavor...the perfect session beer on a hot summer afternoon.
data.foodPairings: Salads, Chicken or lightly grilled tilapia taco’s with a fresh Pico de Gallo tomato and corn salsa.

breweries.name: Terrapin Beer Company
breweries.description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

data.name: Golden Ale-ement
data.description: Our latest work of art is a cream ale delicately hopped with Tradition and Liberty hops. To achieve the light, sparkling color, we used 90% Pilsen malt and the rest malted wheat for a little body. Crisp and lemony, Golden Ale-ement makes for a tasty session ale at only 4.6%.

breweries.name: Gizmo Brew Works
breweries.description: Deep in the Umstead Industrial Park, something stirs. Amid the clank of modern machinery, a group of workers busy themselves with one of the world's oldest crafts: brewing. At Gizmo Brew Works, this meeting of contemporary technology and ancient know-how produces a tempting slate of small-batch beers. Inside tanks that hold the equivalent of 1,000 pints each, brewers prep favorites including the smooth and sweet Black Stiletto Stout and the complex Palisade Wasp India Pale Ale with the same care that has earned many of their past beers medals at the Carolina Championship of Beer. They also save room for seasonals, carefully adding a sweet caramel flavor and spicy Noble hops to their altbier. These beers and more make frequent appearances in the brewery's taproom, gracing pint glasses for impromptu toasts or filling up growlers for at-home sips. Never ones to shy away from curious guests, brewers also open up their facility for Saturday tours, walking groups through the beer-making process during 30-minute explorations.

data.name: Golden Booty Cream Ale
data.description:
Formally known as Coon Rock Cream Ale, this beer is a “pre-prohibition” Cream Ale produced with flaked corn for a very creamy and full-bodied beer. Lightly hopped with traditional varieties that would have been grown in Wisconsin a hundred years ago.

The ultimate “Lawn Mower Beer.”

breweries.name: Lake Louie Brewing
breweries.description:
Lake Louie Brewing started out as a mid-life crisis for owner Tom Porter.  He had spent 20+ years in the Engineering field and was looking to make a change in careers and a change in outlook.  Having been homebrewing for a couple of years, Tom wrote a ‘cartoon’ of a business plan that stated that a 3 barrel brewery could make a profit (in the first year, no less!).

Armed with said business plan and a cashed in 401k, Tom and his wife DeAnn proceeded to convert a metal storage shed on their property into a nascent brewery.

Lake Louie Brewing is located on 18.5 acres of land purchased from Tom’s uncle Louie Carpenter (hence the name ‘Lake Louie’) near the small town of Arena, Wisconsin (population: not too many, traffic lights: zero).  Lake Louie was the skinny dipping pond for area youth (including Tom in his day).

At the end of one full year’s brewing, Lake Louie has produced the astounding sum of 106 barrels of beer.  2001 year end totals:  276 barrels.  A 258% increase in one year (lookout Bud!).

data.name: Golden Spike Light Ale
data.description:
Brewed from 100% 2-row pale malt, this crisp and refreshing light colored ale balances a firm bitterness with a light malt character.

Gold - 2009 Great American Beer Festival

data.description: This is our crisp, refreshing, get stuff done beer. Willamette hops add lemon/orange flavors that sit on top of the grainy sweetness leading in to a snappy, dry finish.

breweries.name: Blackrocks Brewery
breweries.description:
At Blackrocks Brewery our mission is to have fun and brew great beer that challenges conventional norms. We offer you a wide variety of beers and rotate them regularly. The Blackrocks experience is: local, unique, and diverse.

Some say we are limited by our small size. We look at it a little differently, located in an old four square house, the brewery and tasting room compliment the small nature of our operation. The setting lends a neighborhood feel and harkens back to a traditional public house where people can meet and play chess or debate politics.

data.name: Grass Cutter Cream Ale
data.description: This light American style ale is a summer thirst quencher. Light-straw in color and crystal-clear with lively carbonation, this ale is brewed with corn to lighten the body and give it a smooth mouth feel. A summer Seasonal, at 4.6% ABV you can enjoy a few of these after cutting the grass!

breweries.name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
breweries.description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.

breweries.name: Bowigens Beer Company
breweries.description: Bowigens Beer Company is an American Craft Brewery located in Casselberry, Florida. We specialize in creative and innovative beers. At Bowigens, we consider ourselves artistic brewers. We’re not interested in creating a beer unless we feel we’re making something that we are truly passionate about. We use ingredients to expand flavor, not cut cost. We focus on quality first and foremost. We're just hoping to open some eyes and start "Recrafting Perceptions."

data.description: The brewers at Pateros Creek have created a brew that is made with all gluten free ingredients for our friends who need an alternative to the standard beer. We specialize in session ales and lagers but always have a 4-5 rotating taps as well. Come check out our tap room with a patio to enjoy Colorado's 300+ days of sunshine!

breweries.name: Cherry Street Brewing Cooperative
breweries.description:
Cherry Street started out as a little garage operation in the foothills of the Rockies and quickly spread and built up great community support. Initially being known as a cooperative, we established our identity as applying cooperative ideals to everyday life. These ideals focus on education, community, and sustainability. We are here for the community just as the community is here for us.

We are a crazy group of people who love to brew lots of beer and share our passion for brewing. Cherry Street always has something fresh and exciting to enjoy. We continue to come up with crazy off the wall recipes and experiment with unusual ingredients and wild yeast.

Based in Vickery Village of Cumming, we are in partnership with Rick Tanner’s Grille & Bar. Join us for a pint, or swing by the brewery for a tour.

breweries.name: Bare Bones Brewery
breweries.description: Bare Bones Brewery is located on the beautiful north side of Oshkosh, just off the scenic Wiouwash Trail. With his many years of experience, the brewmaster will be brewing up delicious hand-crafted beers throughout the year. Local flavor abounds at the brewery, as the guest taps and spirits are all made in Wisconsin. Visitors can enjoy tours, tastings and monthly beer tasting bike rides (weather permitting, of course) at Bare Bones Brewery. If you are hungry, the brewery offers food, such as pizzas and pretzels, or, if you choose, you can carry-in or have something delivered.

data.description: Our Cream Ale is a traditional beer that emulates the American Standard Lager, but is brewed with ale yeast. Light-bodied, smooth, and unbelievably drinkable. It’s the perfect lawn mower beer for a hot summer day.

Sometimes referred to as cream ales, these beers are crisp and refreshing. Pale malt character predominates. Caramelized malt character should be absent. A fruity or estery aroma may be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.

breweries.name: Meadowlark Brewing
breweries.description: Packaging Brewpub in Sidney, Montana.

data.name: Hasen Fuss
data.description: light-bodied, full-flavored Cream Ale with a crisp twist of Czech and German hops.  Great floral nose with a pilsner-like mouth-feel and finish. A very approachable style for new craft beer drinkers but with the flavor and depth for the connoisseur as well.

style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager
style.description: Mild, pale, light-bodied ale, made using a warm fermentation (top or bottom) and cold lagering. Hop bitterness and flavor range from very low to low. Hop aroma is often absent. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.

breweries.name: Urban Legend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Urban Legend Brewing Company makes unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We believe that our beer can make the world and our local community a better place! We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Our goal is to support local businesses and American manufacturing wherever possible. We are committed to recycling, reusing, and reducing our carbon footprint while at the same time making unique beers for discerning beer lovers and craft beer newbies. We will think local and will contribute to the local economy. 
The beer we produce will be available in our brewery and at local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Pints in the taproom, growlers to go, and small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers on draught plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. We love to rediscover ancient beer recipes as well as spend a lot of time developing a unique styles.
As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.

breweries.name: Hell Bay Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Hell Bay Brewing Company offers a high quality local beer that is sure to satisfy anyone looking for locally made products. Our beer is made from premium malts, hops, and yeast, handcrafted in small batches to ensure freshness.

Try some today. You will love it.

data.name: Herbal Cream Ale
data.description: Our brewery continues its dedication to innovative and progressive beers. As a Cream Ale it combines the features of a lager (crisp & clean) with the best of an ale (fruity & complex) into one beer.  The special feature of this beverage is that we've introduced a blend of herbs into the finished product. A beer for those seeking an alternative to "mainstream" products and flavors. This beer alivens your senses with its unique fresh taste and aroma.

breweries.description: The South Shore Brewery is dedicated to producing flavorful, innovative products. We use the best of traditional techniques and tap the resources of originality from our professional staff.

data.name: Hibisc-This
data.description: Real Men drink pink beer! But don’t let the color or ingredients fool you! This is a beer for all types of drinkers. This light cream ale has organic hibiscus and bitter orange peel added to create a unique and extremely refreshing beer.

breweries.name: Artifex Brewing Company
breweries.description: Micro Brewery and Tasting room located in San Clemente, CA

data.name: Hickster
data.description: American Cream Ale – the forgotten craft beer.  Traditionally, this ale’s profile could be summed up as a medium-bodied, pale straw looking, well-carbonated, low bitter beer.  Our cream ale, Hickster, has a light biscuity aroma with a hint of citrus.  It is pale-straw and slightly hazy in appearance, with a fluffy white head.  This approachable craft beer has a biscuity malt sweetness followed by crisp cracked corn, finishing dry…just begging for another drink.  The light corn flavor is directly attributed to the cracked corn we mash-in during the brewing processes.  If your palette is exhausted by hop crazy beers and/or just want something clean, refreshing, and malty, then Hickster’s definitely for you.

breweries.name: Scorched Earth
breweries.description: Once upon a time... the brewery's co-founder, optimist and perpetual dreamer – Mike Dallas - decided to turn his love of craft beer, homebrewing, and sharing his passion with others into a plan to open a brewery. Jen, his wife and pragmatist, was a bit skeptical after supporting so many of Mike's "loves," including the guitar, woodworking, and the bagpipes, as well as "careers" including the Air Force, law and public administration. But it was Mike's drive, paired with Jen's new found interest in craft beer, and the intrigue of being a business owner, that eventually led her to support his dream and transform their lives into brewery owners.

breweries.name: Infamous Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The team at IBC hails from a diverse background spanning multiple industries who have settled in ATX from other parts of Texas and from both the East and West Coasts. 
We have been home brewing for quite some time and now we are taking that passion to the next level by offering our creations to as many people as possible.
We are currently in the initial stages of development and hope to begin production by year end. Given the strict licensing process, it will probably be sometime in early 2013 before we can share our beers with the rest of Austin, but we are working hard to make that happen as soon as legally possible.
Much more information will be coming on our planned initial beer selection. In the meantime, continue to check back for updates and continue to spread the word!

breweries.name: Buckeye Brewing Company
breweries.description: Buckeye Brewing began brewing in 1997. The flagship beer, Hippie IPA, was first bottled in 1998. We are one of only three breweries bottling in Cleveland, OH. While well known for hoppy Pale and IPA, other styles shine as well. Buckeye produces everything from German-style Kolsch to Belgian-style Saison. Buckeye’s bottled products can be found in quality bottle shops across Ohio. Buckeye currently brews on a 15 barrel Century brew house. Stay tuned for updates on our front page.

data.name: Hominy Cream Ale
data.description: Boat beer? Lawn mower beer?  Beach beer? Yes to all three. Lower ABV beer “goes down super easy” (according to Joey) and can be enjoyed all day long. Start with one.

breweries.name: Drunk Monkey Brew Werks
breweries.description:
Drunk Monkey Brew Werks is dedicated to making hand crafted artisan beers for the central Pennsylvania area.

We are a 'nano' brewery that is founded on the idea of bringing beers of all styles to the market as dictated by our customers.  We brew what our followers want and what we like. There is no style of beer we won't attempt, but we will always have our standards on hand. We take pride in being a local business and being eco-responsible. This is all about enjoying life and having fun.

data.name: Honey Cream Ale
data.description: This is one of our favorites. In Western New York, cream ale is known as a bit of a “dirty word”.  Despite the somewhat negative connotation, we decided to take a shot at this American style ale.  A delicious brew indeed! With a wonderful amber color and beautiful head, it really is the quintessential beer.  We continue to refine this recipe in search of the perfect balance of flavors.  Don’t be surprised to see this cream ale make our opening cut!

breweries.name: New Buffalo Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Buffalo, New York welcomed in the 20th century with the Pan American Exposition.  It was a time of amazing progress.  Electricity was cutting-edge technology, and the possibilities seemed endless.  Hard times lay ahead for the country and for Buffalo though; The Great War would rage and The Great Depression would last for nearly a decade before the United States would emerge from the second World War as the leader of the Free World.

What does any of that have to do with a startup craft-brewery?  The New Buffalo Brewing Co. shares the same passion for progress.  Buffalo produced over half a million barrels of brew in 1896, but by the end of the 1970's, production halted to almost zero. The United States is emerging from that low point as the world leader in brewing. Home brewing is continually growing, and new nano-breweries are popping up everywhere. Once again, The United States is leading the way by taking brewing forward into the next golden age.

So raise your glass in a toast to progress; It’s time to bring brewing back to Buffalo!

data.name: Honey Cream Ale
data.description:
Honey Cream Ale is fermented warm like traditional cream ales but features an added twist--wildflower honey from Oregon. Honey imparts a dry, refreshing character to the beer because it ferments almost completely. The honey comes from a beekeeper in Blodgett, a tiny town 20 miles east of Newport.

Rogues Honey Cream Ale is a light, smooth, medium bodied ale, with a creamy head, hints of honey and a crisp light finish. Brewed with two-row Harrington, Klages and Munich malts and Crystal hops. Discontined for distribution in late 2005, available on tap only at Rogue Ales Public Houses.

breweries.name: Rogue Ales
breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

locations.name: Rogue Ales at the Portland Airport

breweries.name: I & I Brewing
breweries.description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.

data.name: Honey Cream Ale
data.description: Our American Style Cream Ale is not your Grandfather's Cream Ale. Made with pale and honey malts, this smooth, lightly carbonated beer balances maltiness, sweetness and distinct lager like yeast flavors. This beer is extremely drinkable and full of flavor

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

data.name: Honey Cream Ale
data.description: A smooth, blond ale brewed with local honey and lagered for crispness featuring delicate hop aroma and balanced bitterness from Willamete hops.

breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.

data.name: Honey Pecan Cream Ale
data.description: Not too sweet and not too nutty, our flagship beer is a well balanced, full bodied cream ale. Its malt forward flavor is met with a subtle honey aroma and a smooth praline-like finish.

breweries.name: Seguin Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
SMALL TOWN, BIG NUTS!

At Seguin Brewing Company we use a combination of old and new brewing techniques to bring you delicious hand crafted beer.  Driven by our passion and our taste buds, we refuse to settle for a poor product.  We hope that you'll enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you.  Drink local. Drink craft.

breweries.name: New Albanian Brewing
breweries.description: The Brewery was officially brewing in October 2002 and was incorporated in 1994 as the New Albanian Brewing Company in a room that branches off of Sportstime Pizza. The brewery established by Roger Baylor his wife Amy (O'Connell) Baylor and her sister Kate O'Connel. This is the first commercial brewery in New Albany since 1935. The first brewmaster was Michael Borchers which brought with him experience and used machines from the now defunct Silver Creek Brewing Corporation that was located in Sellersburg, Indiana. Jared Williamson and Jesse Williams are the current brewers working the brewery. In 2005, 14,000 gallons of beer was produced by the brewery, and with the new additions, the planned output for 2007 is double the 2005 amount.

breweries.name: Laughing Dog Brewing
breweries.description: At Laughing Dog Brewing, what began with a dream for brews with more hops has turned into an insatiable desire to craft beers of all flavors, with a focus on quality, purity, and fun. Today, Laughing Dog brews has brewed over 15 distinct beers, including seasonals like our Huckleberry Ale and Winter Ale, and our award-winning IPA's and Stouts. But despite our success and growth, our motto remains the same as the day we started, to create... "Fetchingly Good Beer"!

data.name: Illegally Blonde
data.description: An imperial vanilla cream ale served on nitro. It is full bodied courtesy of flaked oats and flaked barley.

breweries.name: Lompoc Brewing
breweries.description:
The New Old Lompoc opened on May 6th, 2000. But the Old Lompoc Brewery (as it was formerly know) has been producing handcrafted ales and lagers since December 1996, while the tavern has been open since 1993.

The name originally came from the movie ‘The Bank Dick’ starring W.C. Fields and Mae West. Most of the movie took place in the ‘Old Lompoc House’, which was the local watering hole as well as a boarding house.

Our food menu is an excellent array of Northwest pub fare with a great selection of entrees, soups and salads. We have also remodeled the patio and added a sun deck.

breweries.name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
breweries.description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

data.name: Imperial Cream Ale
data.description: Our World Beer Cup Silver medal winner is back! Crisp, smooth, light and packing one hell of a punch.

breweries.name: Nexus Brewery
breweries.description:
Nexus Brewery is dedicated on being the Albuquerque brewery that people can count on when it comes to providing amazing tasting beer and excellent food. We love good beer, and that makes our job just that much more fun. We sell delicious New Mexican soul food with a mix of southern comfort food. Come on down to Nexus Brewery and enjoy the beer we brew. We’d love to meet you and pour you a cold one.

You don't just drink a beer; you drink in the experience of life and all that goes with it.

Throw in the best beer in Albuquerque and it's an ExBeerience.

data.name: Imperial Cream Ale
data.description: Soft, Pale malt aroma shine through on the nose, with a touch of alcohol. The body is bigger than our regular cream ale and has a more pronounced malt sweetness that is backed up with a slow alcohol heat.

style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager
style.description: Mild, pale, light-bodied ale, made using a warm fermentation (top or bottom) and cold lagering. Hop bitterness and flavor range from very low to low. Hop aroma is often absent. Sometimes referred to as cream ales, these beers are crisp and refreshing. Pale malt character predominates. Caramelized malt character should be absent. A fruity or estery aroma may be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.

breweries.name: Dangerous Man Brewing Company
breweries.description: Dangerous Man Brewing Company’s mission is to be a destination tap house brewery in Minneapolis, focusing on high-quality small-batch production beers. With ever-changing taps, we will be the hub for lovers of beer and those seeking everything from the traditional to the extreme in their glass.

data.name: Inca
data.description: An India Cream Ale, Inca is our reinvention of a classic American style with West Coast sensibilities. Light and hoppy.
data.foodPairings: Cajun food, spicy food, BBQ, burgers and hot dogs. Highly recommended for crawfish/ shrimp boils and baseball games.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Saint Benjamin Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Saint Benjamin Brewing Company is a nano-brewery operating in Philadelphia, PA. The brewery is located in the historic carriage house and stables of the now defunct Finkenauer Brewery. The quickly growing brewery is known for their reinterpretation of classic styles, and designing new creations such as Inca and Liaison Saison. 

The business was established in 2010, and opened its doors in 2014.

breweries.name: Starving Artist Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Starving Artist Brewing Co. is a production only facility producing beers full of awesomeness. Get a hold of us to schedule a tour of our massive brewery... Cheers

data.name: Insatiable Bread Substitute (IBS)
data.description: IBS isn’t always a bad thing… if it refers to our gluten reduced American Cream Ale, at least! We brewed this light, clean, and crisp Cream Ale with 100% American malted barley, maize, and Warrior hops, then enzymatically treated the beer to break down the remaining glutens.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager

breweries.name: Belly Love Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Why Belly Love?

Well... it's hard to put into words the thoughts that led to the name, because so much of it is simply the feeling you have when you consume a carefully, dare I say lovingly, crafted beer. Complex and simple at the same time. Satiating but refreshing. Nourishment for your senses. Quite plainly; beer is liquid soul food.

We feel that beer makes bellies happy and shows them love. So... raise a glass, love your belly; Belly Love!

data.name: Irish Cream Ale
data.description: Shannon Irish Cream Ale is our modern take on an ancient Irish recipe. Shannon Irish Cream Ale is brewed to have a subtle malt start and the rich character associated with the finest Irish pale ales. It is fermented with ale yeast at a low temperature, causing the yeast to halt fermentation just before full attenuation. The beer is allowed to settle for a few days before we start a secondary fermentation with a lager yeast. This combination of yeast and fermentation temperatures gives Shannon Irish Cream Ale a complex start with wonderful fruit aromas reminiscent of apricot and pears. It also provides the drinker a crisp and dry finish. In a word…awesome!

breweries.name: Shannon Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Shannon Brewing, we are passionate about great beer—all natural, beautiful, wholesome, easy-drinking beer! Shannon Brewing Company’s great beer comes from a profound commitment to our “old-world” brewing process, the best natural ingredients available and a VERY patient aging process.

data.name: Jeffrey Kream Ale
data.description:
Jeffrey Kream Ale has plenty hops, both bitter and floral.

Pilsner, and the more noticeable wheat and Munich malts, keep this brew mellow and crisp.

Pushed with nitrogen.
